intro: Marsdenia gazensis, commonly known as the Ganzhou Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
